cheatsheet.title: Generating a project for your data

intro.description: Debrief NG stores data in a local folder called Project. You place analysis files and links to existing data folders on your machine/network into this folder. This tutorial will lead you through creating a new, blank project.

item.title: Check you need a project
item.description: If you have to create a project, please move on to the next step. If the Navigator view is empty, then you will need to create a new project. If the window already contains a folder icon (possibly containing sample data), then you're ready to go and can move on to the next cheat sheet.

item.title: Create a general project
item.description:
To create a 'general project':
1. Right-click anywhere in the Navigator view, the New sub-menu will display.
2. Select Project...
3. The New Project wizard will open:
4. Click on the General folder, then select Project.
5. Click on the Next button. You will now Create a new project resource.
6. Enter a name for your project (perhaps the name of the current exercise, or another meaningful name).
If you're in a workplace where users are unable to create folders in their home directory, clear the Use default location checkbox, and Browse to a folder in your personal working directories. (Note: you can ignore 'Working Sets' for now).
7. Click on the Finish button.
You will see the new project in your workspace.
